item.title: Top App for the Self-Employed & Road Warrior – ProtonVPN
item.dc:creator: Ricardo Romanillos
item.description: The post Top App for the Self-Employed & Road Warrior – ProtonVPN appeared first on Marquee Results.
item.content:encoded:
If you’re reading this, no doubt that like me you’ve found yourself in a dire situation where you HAD to connect your laptop to the interweb. Something exploded in the office, your boss had to have something 5 minutes ago – you know that thing you’ve already sent them – or perhaps it was finally time to check-in for your Southwest flight and you didn’t pony up the $15 for early check-in.

Open Wifi

 

So there I am in a Starbucks and the only wifi available is the free wifi sponsored by AT&T. Queue disgust and aversion. I feel like they should hand out those toilet cover sheets when you get onto a Free Wifi, because you have no idea what is waiting for you when you connect. And moreover, who might still be on the network that is just licking their lips waiting for you to jump on.

 

Free internet is an unseemly way to connect that leaves you exposed to others who know how to snoop on your traffic. Because of these dangers, the FTC has gone so far as to publish its own tips for Using Public Wi-Fi. This also explains the recent spate of Private VPN services available to the business traveller, and the self-employed who count Starbucks as their conference room. In fact, I just shared a breakdown of the top VPN services with a friend yesterday from PcMag – Best VPN Services of 2017.

 

If you aren’t super familiar with what a VPN does, in short it encrypts your traffic and shields your identity from the prying eyes of hackers and telecom companies. Most importantly, it can increase your level of security when using an open network. If you’d like to learn more about the technical aspects of VPN tunnels, check here.

Now at this point in the infomercial the announcer proclaims you too can get a VPN service for $19.99/mo, so you would be correct in feeling like this might be leading to a sales pitch. But, on June 19th the group that brought us encrypted email

is now providing a quality VPN service that starts at FREE!

Proton Technologies

Proton Technologies is committed to safe and private internet. Their website proclaims:

“Our goal is to build an internet that respects privacy and is secure against cyberattacks.”

The scientists and engineers behind ProtonMail and ProtonVPN started together at CERN, and they represent the most prestigious universities. On the information page for ProtonVPN they explain some of the ways that this new offering improves upon some of the well-known vulnerabilities in VPN. If you’re still amazed that this is coming to you for free, rub your eyes but you can rest assured that the power of open source is alive and kicking.

The entry level provides service for one device at a time, and it does limit the connection speed. I promptly signed up for the intro and have used it from home. I found the connection speed to be sufficient for basic work (Outlook, etc.) and light surfing – very light. Going to NYTimes.com I measured download speeds of KB/s through a US server. This compares with my phone on AT&T LTE where downloads are at speeds of MB/s. 

Given this speed, power users with multiple devices may be inclined to purchase the higher packages. Fortunately, even those more expensive subscriptions are still economical. Find out more on their pricing page. For myself, I plan on utilizing this free plan for some time.

If you work on the go & use open wifi anywhere, STOP & download @protonvpn today #entrepreneur

So, let’s summarize – If you work on the go and find yourself using open networks (coffee shops, hotels, airports, etc), STOP and download this, or any other VPN service.

Enjoy!

item.title: 3 Local Business Marketing Strategies
item.dc:creator: Ricardo Romanillos
item.description: The post 3 Local Business Marketing Strategies appeared first on Marquee Results.
item.content:encoded:
Stuart Guest-Smith

Local business marketing strategies have become increasingly complex. Now that the digital age is upon us, local businesses need to focus more than ever on adopting new marketing strategies to boost their business potential. Below, we will be going over some of the top local business marketing strategies that you are going to want to familiarize yourself with and implement into your own business.

 

3 Local Business Marketing Strategies

1. Social Media

 

Social media has to be one of (if not the biggest) potential medium to market a local business. Social media offers unlimited potential for local businesses because it allows you the opportunity to directly market to your local market and target customers. Because you are able to tailor your social media marketing and advertising directly to hit your target customer, it is one of the best and most efficient ways to market just about any business on the Internet. Another good thing about social media is the fact that it is a ‘social’ platform. Therefore, you can expect your marketing message to transcend across various markets and really capture a large audience. As a result, it can provide one of the best potential returns on investment that any marketing strategy can produce. Social media has to be in your playbook if you are looking for effective yet efficient ways to market a local business.

2. Pay Per Click

 

If you are looking to capture a local market, you will want to consider investing in Pay Per Click (PPC) advertising. This is easily one of the best ways to successfully target and capture various customers within your respective niche or industry.

By focusing on utilizing the data that is given to you, it should allow you  to target your  ideal customers. This is going to allow you to reach a market that is likely to be much more receptive to your marketing and advertising campaigns. Thus, you should be able to achieve much better overall results with it.

3. Direct Mail

 

While direct mail has certainly received a lot less attention in recent years, the effectiveness of direct mail has never gone away. It remains one of the best ways to market a local business even in today’s technological age.

Because you are going to be able to get something physical delivered directly to those that are most likely to frequent your business and because you can target them much in the same ways as you would online, it should allow for a good overall return on investment. In fact, with the new technological advancements in the space, you can now think of ways to track your direct mail campaigns such as with a landing page or another tracking tool that can help dictate the success or failure of any particular campaign.

 

Overall, there are so many ways in which you can successfully market a local business in today’s competitive marketplace. The strategies above are only some of the best ways to do so.

item.title: Local Search Engine Optimization Factors 2018
item.dc:creator: Ricardo Romanillos
item.description: The post Local Search Engine Optimization Factors 2018 appeared first on Marquee Results.
item.content:encoded:
Local SEO Guide 2018

 

Search Engine Optimization is something that is determined by a very complex algorithm developed by companies like Google and Bing. No one knows exactly what the algorithm consists of in fine detail, but there are several factors that go into the ranking of websites. While the classics never change, innovation is changing the search engine ecosystem. To make sure you local business is future-proof, we go over some of the Best Local SEO Factors for 2018.

1. Social Media

 

Do you tweet, ‘gram, like, or share?   Social media has only grown in importance for local companies. Boost your local rankings by getting a good following on social media and having more people talk about your business or website on social media.

 

Social media is a huge part of our lives nowadays. Therefore, it only makes sense for it to be a huge factor when it comes to ranking websites on the search engines. The more social media interaction, fans, likes that you are able to get on your various social media platforms, the better your website is likely to rank.

 

Your social media is the best way to also ensure you’re listening and engaging with residents. If you have an important business questions, there’s no better sounding board than your fans on Facebook or Twitter. Ask them!

 

TIP: Make sure you have accounts with all the top social media platforms: Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Google+, LinkedIn, Tumblr, Vimeo, and YouTube. Once you have them, then focus on one and engage with your followers.

2. Relevant Links

 

One of the biggest factors that influence your rankings are links. Links have only gained in importance over the years, but not all links are created equally.   Having good links pointing to your website has become very important when it comes to achieving high rankings.

 

What make a link good? Relevancy!   Backlinks must be relevant for your niche. Link from high ranking websites shows that your website is relevant too. Therefore, make sure that you are paying attention to relevancy first and authority second.

3. Content

 

We’ve all heard it – Content is King!   A major ranking factor that you need to focus on within your website is the content that you produce.

 

Not only do you want to pay attention to the type of content you produce, but you want to be sure that you are creating as high quality content as possible. The better your content and the higher quality it is, the better it is going to end up ranking. You want to focus on relevant content that matches up with local searches in order to really be able to rank well locally.

 

TIP: Look to resources such as Buzzsumo or Answer The Puplic to gain insight into what your avatar wants to learn from your website. Relevant content gets shared!

4. Keywords

 

When it comes to ranking factors, everything start with the keywords for your niche, service, or agency. The keywords that you are targeting is one of the major things that you want to look at because you want to find the keywords that are actually going to get your website ranking for the right local searches.

 

A focus on the right keywords is crucial if you really want to rank as high as possible for the different keywords within your respective market and niche. By choosing the right keywords, you will be able to get your website to rank well for the right search terms.

 

TIP: Use search engine autocomplete features to find out what people are typing. Don’t just think about Google, Amazon does this too! For example, check out the results when I type in dallas plastic surgery.

 

 

 

5. Citations

Listing your website and service with citations such as Yelp and Foursquare is another ranking factor that never goes out of style. Although the Yellow Pages have become mostly a nuisance when it arrives on our door step, YellowPages.com remains a relevant citation.

 

The most important factor for citations is to ensure your business information is uniform across all sites. If you have old listings, make sure you edit them to reflect new listings.

 

TIP: Yext and others wants to charge you for your citations. Forgo the middleman and look for the FREE listing. The link will be small, but it’s there!

 

Overall, there is a lot that you are going to want to look at and consider when it comes to getting your website to rank in 2018. By following these Search Engine Optimization Factors for 2018, you should be able to maximize your local rankings and dominate your area.
